title.native: とある魔術の禁書目録III

description:
Science, magic, and a nun on the run! Kamijo and Index return just in time to celebrate A Certain Magical Index’s 10th anniversary with a brand-new season. After their deadly struggle against the Catholic Church and the pending war between magic and science, Kamijo must work harder to protect Index. But with tensions high all around, what new adventures await them in this next chapter?

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: อินเดกซ์คัมภีร์คาถาต้องห้าม ภาค 3
Cấm thư ma thuật Index III

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Nun
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nishiki_hiroshi)

He is unilaterally liked by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara). His work on [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/Revolutionary-Girl-Utena/) storyboards were outright claimed to be the "closest to his own style" , in principle, by Ikuhara himself.

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

Kiyoko Sayama is a Japanese director, episode director, animation director and storyboard artist.

Married to [Tetsuya Kumagai](https://anilist.co/staff/101548/Tetsuya-Kumagai).

[Website](http://whv-amusic.com/iguchiyuka/index.html) | [Profile](http://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/iguchiyuka/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yukachiofficial) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ooo31_iguchiyuka_31ooo/) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/15320.html) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuka_Iguchi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BA%95%E5%8F%A3%E8%A3%95%E9%A6%99) | [Youtube](https://youtube.com/@officialyoutubechannel3974?si=9AjlJ6Ujj2Vw1CiU)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Liter - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Otaru Rio - Nogizaka Haruka no Himitsu: Cosplay, Hajimemashita (VN)
- 37 - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Koleda Belobog - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)

[Profile](http://nbcuni-music.com/maon/profile/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kurosakimaon) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/kurosakimaon) | [Youtube](http://www.youtube.com/user/maongue) 

Maon Kurosaki was a Japanese singer and songwriter signed to NBCUniversal Entertainment Japan. After being discovered while working as a performer in Akihabara, Tokyo, she made her major debut in 2010, performing ending themes to the anime television series Highschool of the Dead. She released her debut album H.O.T.D. in September 2010, which features the ending themes from Highschool of the Dead. Her first two singles were used as ending themes to the anime television series A Certain Magical Index II.

Kurosaki's music is influenced by her love of anime and lolita fashion. Her songs have been featured in various anime series such as Jormungand, Tokyo Ravens, and The Fruit of Grisaia. She has collaborated with artists such as Mami Kawada, Kotoko, and Trustrick for her music releases. She performed twice at Anime Expo 2011 in Los Angeles, California, and is a regular performer at Japanese anime events such as LisAni, Animelo Summer Live, and Animax Musix. She has also appeared at Anime Festival Asia, Bangkok Comic Con, and CharaExpo. From 2011 to 2016, she was singer of the synthpop band [ALTIMA](https://anilist.co/staff/109511/), together with Motsu of the band Move.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/245226/Yuuichi-Tanaka)._
